brand_info.name: KitKat
brand_info.tagline: Have a break... have a Kit Kat!
brand_info.positioning: An essential companion for much-needed moments of respite and relaxation in busy lives, synonymous with taking a break and enjoyment.
brand_info.vision: To be the leading nutrition, health, and wellness company in the world (as part of Nestlé). For KitKat specifically, it is positioned as the world's favorite break, an international symbol for hitting the pause button on life to enjoy a well-earned break.
brand_info.mission: To provide consumers with the best tasting, most nutritious choices in a wide range of food and beverage categories and eating occasions (as part of Nestlé's 'Good Food, Good Life' mission). To enhance the quality of life and contribute to a healthier future (as part of Nestlé).
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in the 1930s by British confectionery company Rowntree's in the United Kingdom. Launched in September 1935 as 'Rowntree's Chocolate Crisp' after a worker suggested 'a chocolate bar that a man could take to work in his pack up'. Renamed Kit Kat Chocolate Crisp in 1937, and simply Kit Kat after World War II.

brand_values.brand_promise: To provide a delightful and satisfying break from daily routines and demands.
differentiators: Universal recognition of 'Have a Break' tagline
Wide variety of flavors and formats globally
Association with moments of personal pause and enjoyment
non_negotiables: The distinct chocolate and wafer combination

demographics.income_level: Middle to lower-income classes (affordable treat), broader for premium offerings

psychographics.lifestyle: Busy, seeking moments of escape, appreciative of simple pleasures, digitally engaged, value convenience
psychographics.behavior: Frequent snacking, uses breaks to recharge, engages with social media, seeks small indulgences

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Direct, lighthearted, conversational, often uses humor and relatable scenarios.
tone_of_voice.language_register: Informal to semi-formal, accessible, avoids jargon.
preferred_structures: Questions that invite reflection on needing a break
tone_dos: Offer KitKat as a simple solution for a break
Encourage moments of pause and enjoyment
tone_donts: Sound condescending or preachy about taking breaks
Focus solely on product features without linking to the 'break' benefit
Use overly complex or intellectual humor
Be overly aggressive in sales messaging

logo.primary_logo: Red oval with white 'KitKat' text, often with a white outline. Sometimes a smaller, simpler red rectangle with white text.
logo.usage_rules: Must be clearly visible, often placed in a corner or at the bottom of the frame. Maintained consistent proportions and color.
logo.lockup_behavior: Often paired with the 'Have a break, have a Kit Kat' tagline. Can appear alone or integrated into packaging/campaign visuals.
logo.safe_area: Sufficient clear space around the logo to ensure legibility and prominence.

secondary_colors: Vibrant accent colors (for specific flavors or campaign themes, e.g., green for matcha, pink for ruby chocolate)
color_system.color_usage_rules: Primary red is consistently used for brand recognition. Secondary colors support product variations or campaign moods while maintaining brand consistency. Bright and inviting palettes are preferred.

typography.primary_font: Sans-serif, bold, rounded, friendly (e.g., similar to Arial Rounded MT Bold or custom brand font)
typography.secondary_font: Clean, legible sans-serif for body copy (e.g., Arial, Helvetica)

spacing.letter_spacing: Standard to slightly loose for headlines, standard for body.

layout_principles.grid_system: Flexible, often centered or rule-of-thirds for key elements, allowing for dynamic and engaging compositions.
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: Moderate to high, ensuring clarity and preventing clutter, giving elements room to 'breathe'.
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-dominant, with text supporting the visual narrative. Product shots are central.
layout_principles.cta_placement: Clear and prominent, typically at the bottom right or center-bottom of the layout.
layout_principles.alignment: Often center-aligned for headlines and key messages, left-aligned for body text for readability.

style.camera_feel: Natural, often eye-level or slightly elevated to capture human interaction and product detail. Sometimes uses a slightly wider lens for environmental context.
style.pose_guidelines: Relaxed, natural, expressive of relief or enjoyment. Hands often shown holding, unwrapping, or breaking the KitKat. Active poses before the break, calm/happy poses during the break.
style.casting_attitude: Diverse, friendly, approachable, genuine expressions of emotion (frustration, then joy/calm).

technical.lighting: Bright, natural, often soft daylight or studio lighting to highlight product texture and appeal. Avoids harsh shadows on the product.
technical.contrast: Medium to high, ensuring clarity and vibrancy without being overly dramatic.
technical.grain: Minimal to none, aiming for a clean and polished look.
technical.depth_of_field: Shallow to medium, often focusing on the KitKat bar or the person interacting with it, blurring backgrounds to emphasize the subject.
technical.color_grading: Warm and inviting, enhancing the natural colors of chocolate and packaging, creating an appealing and comforting mood.

preferred_locations: Everyday settings (offices, homes, public transport, parks, cafes)
Situations depicting mild stress or busy-ness
Relaxing environments (e.g., a quiet corner, outdoors)

model_casting.age_range: Broad, from young adults to middle-aged individuals, sometimes children for family-oriented campaigns.
model_casting.diversity: Ethnically and culturally diverse, reflecting global consumer base.
model_casting.attitude: Authentic, relatable, expressive of everyday emotions (stress, relief, joy, contentment).

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Always prominent and clearly visible, often in the foreground or central to the composition. The 'snap' is a key visual element.
product_presentation.styling_approach: Clean, simple, focus on the product's iconic shape and texture. Often shown unwrapped or partially unwrapped, ready to be eaten. Sometimes integrated into a larger scene naturally.
avoid: Product being obscured or secondary to other elements
Unrealistic or overly staged product placements

motion_rules.pacing: Starts with a slightly faster pace depicting busy-ness or frustration, then slows down to emphasize the moment of the break and enjoyment.
motion_rules.transitions: Smooth, often cutting from a chaotic scene to a calm one, or focusing on the act of breaking and eating the KitKat. Visual metaphors for 'breaking free' are common.

visual_dos: Show people genuinely enjoying their break with KitKat
Highlight the iconic 'snap' and wafer texture
Use bright, appealing colors and lighting
Ensure the KitKat product is clearly visible and appetizing
visual_donts: Show people stressed or unhappy while consuming KitKat
Obscure the product or make it difficult to identify
Use dull or uninviting color palettes
Feature messy or unappealing product shots
copy_dos: Reinforce the 'Have a Break' message consistently
Use warm, friendly, and encouraging language
Connect KitKat to moments of relaxation and enjoyment
Be concise and easy to understand
copy_donts: Use jargon or overly complex language
Focus on negative emotions without offering a solution

must_remain: The 'Have a break, have a Kit Kat' tagline
The core product form (chocolate-covered wafer fingers)
The brand's association with taking a moment to pause and recharge
The red and white color scheme of the primary logo
can_evolve: Campaign themes and creative executions (e.g., 'Break Better', AI campaign)
Digital and social media engagement strategies
test_zone: New product formats beyond traditional bars
Partnerships with unexpected brands or technologies
Highly localized campaigns with unique cultural adaptations
Interactive experiences that redefine the 'break' concept

interactive_elements: QR codes for contests or exclusive content
retail.soundscape: Upbeat, light, and pleasant music, or ambient sounds of relaxation/enjoyment. The iconic jingle (in US) or 'snap' sound.

digital.tone_adjustment: More informal and interactive on social media, slightly more informative on the website.

content_ratio.motion_vs_static: 70% motion (short videos, GIFs), 30% static images (product shots, lifestyle)

platform_behavior.Instagram: Visually driven, high-quality imagery and short, engaging videos. Focus on lifestyle, humor, and product appeal. Uses stories and reels for interactive content.
platform_behavior.Website: Comprehensive brand information, product catalog, history, sustainability efforts, campaign archives. Clear navigation and appealing visuals.
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Updates on new products, exclusive offers, behind-the-scenes content, links to campaigns and brand stories. Friendly and informative tone.

print.paper: High-quality, glossy paper for advertisements and promotional materials to enhance visual appeal and product texture.
print.cover_rules: Bold imagery, clear brand logo and tagline, minimal text, strong visual impact to capture attention quickly.

logo_misuse_examples: Changing the brand's primary red color
Placing the logo on busy or clashing backgrounds without sufficient clear space
Using outdated versions of the logo
Altering the typeface of the 'KitKat' wordmark
